data.title: EastEnders actress Jessie Wallace to star in Chicago at Liverpool Empire
data.meta_description: The actress, best known at Kat Slater, will play jail matron Mama Morton
data.text:
The actress, best known at Kat Slater, will play jail matron Mama Morton

EastEnders actress Jessie Wallace will take on the role of feisty Mama Morton in a new stage production of the award-winning musical Chicago when it comes to Liverpool this autumn.

The soap favourite, best known for playing Albert Square’s Kat Slater, will play the no-nonsense corrupt matron of the county jail block who reminds female inmates ‘When you’re good to Mama, Mama’s good to you!’”

‌

READ MORE: EastEnders actress joins Wizard of Oz cast in St Helens

She will star alongside John Partridge as Billy Flynn, Hayley Tamaddon as Roxie Hart and Sophie Carmen-Jones as Velma Kelly in the show which will run for a week at the Empire from Monday September 12 to Saturday September 17.

‌

Liverpool Echo Icon

Sign up to FREE email alerts from ECHO Daily News

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you’ve consented to and improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and third parties based on our knowledge of you. More info

Since it opened at London’s Adelphi Theatre back in November 1997 to rave reviews, Chicago has gone on to win a Laurence Olivier Award for Outstanding Musical Production and Critics Circle Drama Award for Best Musical. A sell-out hit, it is currently playing in New York where it holds the record as the longest running musical revival and also the second longest running musical in Broadway history.

‌

‌

As the tough but sexy Mama Morton, Jessie - whose stage credits include Rent Remixed in the West End - will follow in the footsteps of Queen Latifah who played the role in the multi-Oscar winning film version, and Modern Family’s Sofia Vergara who made her Broadway debut as Mama in 2009.
